reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: (Envelop 2): Strengthen the protective environment of vulnerable women, girls, and boys through enhance livelihoods, socio-economic self-reliance, and financial empowerment of conflict-affected households in Jandairis Sub-District

description.narrative:
The proposed intervention is based on SADAD’s approved submission to the 2022 HPC and will enhance 19467 conflict-affected IDPs and host people's resilience 4461 Men, 4917 Women, 4775 Boys, and 5314 Girls) towards further economic shocks and IDP-influxes. Taking into account the close correlation/ integration between livelihood and early recovery programs, and the urgent need for parallel intervention in both sectors at different levels (household, and community level). SADAD conducted an FSL project regarding bread distribution in the same proposed targeted area funded by SCHF, which ended in April 2022, and as a complementarity action, SADAD will build on it through bread production activity and so enhance IDPs' access to bread sources. Depending on SADAD field team obseration and need assessment findings/recommendations conducted in May 222, SADAD developed the proposed action, where the following activities will be prioritized and achieved through an evidence-based, quality-focused integrated program of astance, the proposed action comprises main activities with regards to wheat marketing and bread access and availability to IDPs in camps. In addition to enhancing knowledge and skills by adopting improvedmethods of agri-food processing and improved nutrition status at the household level, through the establishment of small food processing female workshops. Moreover, the planned intervention aims to aleviate the negative impacts of severe economic deterioration by supporting the provision of economic and livelihood opportunities which will be critical to building and strengthening both HH and community resiliencethrough the rehabilitation of public infrastructure affected by years-long conflict, following cash injections through CFW activities, labor markt-informed vocational and skills training, and support business assets through financial (grants). BNFs will gain resilience through developing a sustainable business that will generate an income in the longer term. The geographical scope focuses on the underserved areas in Jandairis SD. Over 3661 HHs are to be reached throughout the locations targeted by this project. At least 5% PwDs. Participation will be open to residents and IDPs. Under ERL, the project targets 150 individuals (65 men, 85 women) to be involved in ERL intervention as the following: - support 200 female-headed households will be referred to attend a 6-day SME training. - provide 80 female-headed households supported with small grants of 750$. - provide 65 male and 5 female CFW workers to be involved in the rehabilitation works. . Under FSL, the project will support 19349 individuals (4744 men, 5407 women, 4323 boys, 4875 girls) to be targeted with life-saving food security assistance: - Support 17694 individuals (4044 men, 4452 women, 4323 boys, and 4875 girls) with free bread distribution. -Provide 780 CFW workers (100 men, 680 women) to participate in olive harvesting targeting 400 hectares of olives - Support 825 farmers/ landowners with harvesting workers. - Select 50 female-headed households to be supported with assets to start a food-processing workshop.
The needs assessment findings illustrated that there is a high need to target those surveyed locations by increasing integration with ERL, FSL, and protection based on household and community levels.
